name: BEST WESTERN Leesburg Hotel & Conference Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was excellent; close to highways, shopping, restaurants, and wineries. Breakfast was hot, plentiful, tasty, and free. Service was friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself was just okay. We paid $79/night and that's exactly what the room was worth. We were placed in #102 and the spotlight shone through our curtain all night , plus we were next to the exit door which was very noisy. After the first night of no sleep, we requested a quieter room facing the pool at the back of the hotel, were moved to #213, and we were much happier there.
reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're able to get a cheap rate for this hotel, I'd recommend staying there; however, don't expect 5 star or even 4 star. You get what you pay for at this Best Western.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel in VA Wine Country

likes.disliked: — Odd Smell in Hallway (like old garbage)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights at this hotel to visit the northern VA wine country. We weren't disappointed. Efficient, courteous check-in and check-out. Room (213) was exactly as requested (king, non-smoking in a quiet area). Our room was not recently renovated, but fine for a chain hotel. Nice sitting area and couch. A desk and chair and a very comfy bed. Bathroom was clean and had basic toiletries. This hotel "wins" on the extras. Hot popcorn, coffee and cookies available in the lobby each afternoon and great full breakfast (included) each morning. There were at least four different wedding parties and guests staying there while we visited. Seems to be very popular with the wedding crowd. All in all a quiet, clean, comfy location to stay. Very centrally located to explore wine country and shop at the nearby outlets.
reviews.title: Loved the location, the helpful staff and the cleanliness

reviews.text: We walked in and used a Roomsaver coupon. We spent 3 nights there and loved the location. We had stayed there previously 2 years ago and it was every bit as good once again. The room was very clean, tidy and fresh. The reception area is very clean indeed. The pool is very well maintained and has a lifeguard on duty - a pleasant change from pools without supervision. The breakfast bar had a large range of choices which were alwasy filled up promptly. The breakfast area is large and always clean and tidy. We visited the Frank Lloyd Wright home and George Washington's plantation - it's a great base from which to visit. We also got the train from Springfield Franconia into Washington. There are so many restaurants in the area it was easy to find a good place to eat. We also went to the Movies at Potomac Mills Mall. I would highly recommend this hotel. It has 9 floors but apart from groups at the week-end, it's usually very quiet during the week. It's clean and safe and the staff are pleasant at all times.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.text: EXCELLENT HOTEL ! ! ! Recently renovated the hotel and rooms are very nice. The fireplace in the lobby was nice to sit in front of and read. Fresh hot popcorn, oven baked cookies and fresh coffee is available in the lobby. Front desk staff was very helpful, courteous and friendly. Hot FULL breakfast bar was wonderful. Room was spacious, bed was extremely comfortable, pool was very nice. Having internet access on a computer provided by the hotel was a HUGE plus and the excersize room is always available and clean. Housekeeping staff answered our requests quickly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the Leesburg, VA area. Convienient to Historic Leesburg (10 minutes) and 45 minutes to Washington DC. Outlet mall is right around the corner with economical family restaraunts within 5 minute drive. Great hotel for families and single travelers.
reviews.title: Great value, nice staff, amazing breakfast!

likes.disliked: — Hard to get to by bicycle!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While a little hard to find it was near the outlet mall and tons of good restaurants (try Anita's out front). Room had been recently renovated and was without a doubt four star. Breakfast was hot and they were not stingy on the selection. Big difference was that hotel had a business center which the competitor didn't offer.
reviews.title: Hidden Jewel!

likes.disliked: — Exterior of building didn't reflect the inside

reviews.text: for anyone with a car, this is a fine hotel --- for those on bikes coming from the c&o canal, it's in a bad location (horrible roads to bike to get there) - it's a good hotel otherwise - except for its location, not near anything within walking distance (not downtown, so we never saw leesburg at all) - nice pool, good free breakfast, etc - good for drivers, bad for bikers -
reviews.title: good hotel, poor location for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to do a last minute weekend trip down to Leesburg, and didn't bother booking a hotel first. When we got there, we visited the Tourist Center downtown and were given some hotel suggestions. We were wary about staying at a Best Western since, as other guests have mentioned, they seem to be very hit and miss, but we made up our mind as soon as we walked in to inquire about open rooms. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and despite having a nearly sold out hotel they were willing to help accomodate our preferences. We got a great price ($109) and ended up with a business suite.
reviews.title: Great price, great place!

likes.liked: — Clean & recently renovated rooms, location, friendly staff!

reviews.text: The suite had a small bar area with a coffee maker and sink, a dining room table, a sitting area with a couch and table, and a full size Murphy bed. The hotel has obviously been renovated recently, and the furniture was in great shape. The entire room and bathroom were extremely clean. The bed, although small, was very comfortable and the layout of the room allowed us to watch the brand new plasma screen tv from bed or the couch.
reviews.title: Great Place for a stayover

likes.liked: — The breakfast, the comfortable beds and the cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Decor a little dated but not bad

reviews.text: Although we did not use it, the hotel has an outdoor pool which appeared to be well maintained. The free breakfast in the morning includes a make-your-own waffle bar, sausage, bacon, muffins, cereal, yogurt, and bagels. A great feature was the coin operated laundry located on each floor - definitely helpful if you have been traveling frequently!
reviews.title: Nice and pleasant for a chain motel

likes.liked: — Close to the routes I was using on a road trip
likes.disliked: — Difficult to find, until calling the front desk from my cell phone

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is a little bit tricky to find at first, but being located between Route 7 and Route 15 is so convenient! You are close to all of Leesburg's attractions and the nearby highways give you access to the rest of beautiful Loudoun County's attractions. There are several shopping complexes nearby, a lot of restaurants, and even a 24-hour market within walking distance. We did see police offers driving through the parking lot several times, so even though the hotel seems to be in a safe area it is reassuring to know that the parking lot is being monitored.
reviews.title: A good stopping point.

likes.liked: — Relative value for money in the DC area, friendliness of the staff
likes.disliked: — Tired decor, noise from other guests

reviews.title: great motel
reviews.text: All in all, we were extremely impressed by our stay here - the friendly staff, clean rooms, and convenient location definitely helped us overlook our normally anti-Best Western bias. I definitely recommend the Best Western for a stay in Leesburg, VA!
